electionProcess.overview: Officer elections in the Interlake Programming Club are a democratic process designed to identify and empower students who demonstrate leadership, commitment, and dedication to the club's mission.
electionProcess.timeline: Elections typically occur in the spring semester for the following academic year.
criteria: Active participation and attendance at club meetings
Contributions to club activities and projects
Willingness to help others and mentor members
Commitment to advancing the club's goals

usaco.title: USACO Leadership
usaco.description: Members can develop leadership skills by organizing their own study groups, helping others understand complex algorithms, and teaching problem-solving strategies. Leading USACO sessions helps build communication and mentoring abilities.

projects.title: Project Leadership
projects.description: Take charge of project teams and ensure everyone stays on track with timelines. Project leaders coordinate tasks, facilitate collaboration, manage deadlines, and help bring ideas from concept to reality. This provides real-world project management experience.

participation.title: Active Participation
participation.description: Simply showing up, contributing ideas, and helping out is the foundation of leadership. Consistent participation and taking initiative on tasks demonstrates your commitment and leadership potential.
